identity.title: Provider Identity
identity.desc: Set a unique name to identify this provider

endpoint.title: API Endpoint
endpoint.desc: Configure the base URL for API requests

auth.title: Authentication
auth.desc: Provide your API key for authentication

apiTest.desc: Validate whether the selected provider type and model respond correctly. Defaults to the routing configuration unless overridden.
apiTest.title: Provider Model Test

circuitBreaker.desc: Automatically break on consecutive failures to protect overall service quality

failureThreshold.desc: Number of consecutive failures to trigger break
failureThreshold.label: Failure Threshold
failureThreshold.warning: Setting to 0 disables the circuit breaker - use with caution

maxRetryAttempts.desc: Total tries (including the first call) before switching providers. Leave empty to use the system default.
maxRetryAttempts.label: Max Attempts Per Provider

successThreshold.desc: Number of successes in half-open to fully recover
successThreshold.label: Recovery Threshold

circuitBreaker.summary: {failureThreshold} failures / {openDuration} min break / {successThreshold} successes to recover / {maxRetryAttempts} attempts per provider
circuitBreaker.title: Circuit Breaker

codexStrategy.desc: Control how to handle the instructions field in Codex requests; affects gateway compatibility
codexStrategy.hint: Hint: Some strict Codex gateways (e.g. 88code, foxcode) require official instructions. Choose "Auto" or "Force official".

auto.desc: Pass through client instructions; on 400 error, retry with official prompt
auto.label: Auto (recommended)

force.desc: Always use official Codex CLI instructions (~4000+ chars)
force.label: Force official

keep.desc: Always pass through client instructions, no auto retry (for permissive gateways)
keep.label: Pass-through

codexStrategy.title: Codex Instructions Policy

mcpPassthrough.desc: When enabled, pass through MCP tool calls to specified AI provider (e.g. minimax for image recognition, web search)
mcpPassthrough.hint: Hint: MCP passthrough allows Claude Code client to use tool capabilities provided by third-party AI providers (e.g. image recognition, web search)

custom.desc: Pass through to custom MCP service (reserved, not implemented yet)
custom.label: Custom

glm.desc: Pass through to GLM MCP service (supports image analysis, video analysis, etc.)
glm.label: GLM

minimax.desc: Pass through to minimax MCP service (supports image recognition, web search, etc.)
minimax.label: Minimax

mcpPassthrough.title: MCP Passthrough Configuration
mcpPassthrough.urlDesc: MCP service base URL. Leave empty to auto-extract from provider URL

proxy.desc: Configure a proxy to improve connectivity (HTTP, HTTPS, SOCKS4, SOCKS5 supported)

fallback.desc: When enabled, will try direct connection if proxy fails
fallback.label: Fallback to direct on proxy failure

test.desc: Test accessing provider URL via proxy (HEAD request, no credits consumed)
test.label: Connectivity Test

proxy.title: Proxy

desc.fixed: Reset quota at a fixed time each day
desc.rolling: Reset 24 hours after first API call

rateLimit.desc: Configure spending limits to control costs across different time windows
rateLimit.title: Rate Limit

cacheTtl.desc: Force prompt cache TTL; only affects requests with cache_control.
cacheTtl.label: Cache TTL Override

parallelToolCalls.help: Controls whether parallel tool calls are allowed. "inherit" follows the client request. Disabling may reduce tool-call concurrency.
parallelToolCalls.label: Parallel Tool Calls Override

reasoningEffort.help: Controls how much reasoning effort the model uses before answering. "inherit" follows the client request; other values force override reasoning.effort. Note: "none" is only supported on GPT-5.1 models; "xhigh" is only supported on GPT-5.1-Codex-Max. Using an unsupported value will cause an upstream error.
reasoningEffort.label: Reasoning Effort Override

reasoningSummary.help: Controls whether the Responses API returns reasoning summaries. "auto" returns a condensed summary, "detailed" returns a more comprehensive one. "inherit" follows the client request.
reasoningSummary.label: Reasoning Summary Override

textVerbosity.help: Controls how verbose the model output is. "low" is concise, "high" is verbose. "inherit" follows the client request.
textVerbosity.label: Text Verbosity Override

context1m.desc: Configure 1M context window support. Only affects Sonnet models (claude-sonnet-4-5, claude-sonnet-4). Tiered pricing applies when enabled.
context1m.label: 1M Context Window

unifiedClientId.label: Unified Client ID
unifiedClientId.desc: Use a fixed client identifier for upstream requests (Claude / Claude-Auth providers only).
unifiedClientId.help: The ID is a 64-character hex string. Keep the auto-generated value and avoid reusing it across instances.

simulateCache.label: Simulate cache
simulateCache.desc: Inject simulated cache usage fields for downstream clients (does not affect billing here).
simulateCache.help: When enabled, responses include cache_creation_input_tokens and cache_read_input_tokens for downstream billing and display.

supplementaryPrompt.label: Supplementary Prompt Injection
supplementaryPrompt.desc: Inject custom instructions into requests (e.g., file chunking hints for large outputs).
supplementaryPrompt.help: When enabled, injects custom instructions into the <system-reminder> tag in the request body. Note: Only applies to main agent requests; sub-agent requests are excluded.

joinClaudePool.desc: When enabled, this provider will participate in load balancing with Claude-type providers
joinClaudePool.help: Available only when there is a redirect mapping to claude-* models. When users request claude-* models, this provider also joins scheduling.
joinClaudePool.label: Join Claude Routing Pool

modelWhitelist.desc: Restrict which models this provider can serve. By default, a provider can serve all models of its type.
modelWhitelist.label: Allowed Models
modelWhitelist.selectedOnly: Only the selected {count} models are allowed. Other models will not be routed to this provider.
modelWhitelist.title: Model Allowlist

preserveClientIp.desc: Pass x-forwarded-for / x-real-ip to upstream providers (may expose real client IP)
preserveClientIp.help: Keep off by default for privacy. Enable only when upstream must see the end-user IP.
preserveClientIp.label: Forward client IP

routing.providerTypeDesc: Choose the API format type of the provider.
routing.providerTypeDisabledNote: Note: OpenAI Compatible is under development and currently unavailable

costMultiplier.desc: Cost multiplier. Official provider = 1.0, 20% cheaper = 0.8, 20% more expensive = 1.2 (up to 4 decimals)
costMultiplier.label: Cost Multiplier

group.desc: Group tag. Select from list or type a new name and press Enter to create (max 50 chars). Only users whose providerGroup matches can use this provider.
group.label: Provider Group

priority.desc: Lower value = higher priority (0 is highest). The system only chooses from the highest priority tier. Suggested: primary=0, standby=1, emergency=2
priority.label: Priority

weight.desc: Weighted random. Within the same priority, higher weight increases selection probability. Example 1:2:3 ≈ 16%:33%:50%
weight.label: Weight

routing.title: Routing

timeout.desc: Configure request timeout duration, 0 means disable timeout
timeout.disableHint: Set to 0 to disable the timeout (for canary rollback scenarios only, not recommended)

nonStreamingTotal.desc: Non-streaming request total timeout, range 60-1200 seconds, enter 0 to disable (default: no limit)
nonStreamingTotal.label: Non-streaming Total Timeout (seconds)

streamingFirstByte.desc: Streaming request first byte timeout, range 1-180 seconds, enter 0 to disable (default: no limit)
streamingFirstByte.label: Streaming First Byte Timeout (seconds)

streamingIdle.desc: Streaming request idle timeout, range 60-600 seconds, enter 0 to disable (default: no limit)
streamingIdle.label: Streaming Idle Timeout (seconds)

timeout.title: Timeout Configuration
